page.title: 11THE FARMER'S WIFE
page.content: Electricity was introduced to the farms around 1948. Electricity has made life easier for the farmer's wife in many ways. Before this cooking was done over solid fuel ranges and{ {PARAFFIN}lamps were used for lighting. Farmers' wives no longer find it economic to make butter and cheese or to keep chickens. In any case stray dogs from Dundee's Whitfield housing scheme often killed the chickens. In fact recently sheep on lower fields were being attacked by dogs and had to be moved to other pastures. In the past the farmer's wife had to clean out the{BOTHY}once a month. Bothies were the living quarters of batchelor farm workers who 'did for themselves'. Bothying ended at Shielhill in 1948. Younger wives are now taking courses in book-keeping and accountancy to help their husbands.
